channel.title: Client help
channel.description:
I just finished my client and I got this error: NOTE: I just changed the webclient cache links here is what I get
ava.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\cache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot fi d the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:64) at client.startUp(client.java:7812) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5281) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @ipwnunoobs ipwnunoobs
item.description:
@ipwnunoobs wrote:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\cache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot fi d the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:64) at client.startUp(client.java:7812) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5281) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Didn’t you bother to check the first line of your error?

Your actual problem is that your cache will not download. I don’t know if this works or not but head to your client.java
and serach for BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(signlink.findcachedir()+"/Maps/mapConfig.txt"));

remove the signlink.findcachedir()+ in that line.
Save and Compile.
I think it is a problem with the DSPK source where it immediately goes to search the mapConfig.txt before actually downloading the Cache which results in Error 1-2-3-4-5.

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

It’s not because he zipped it wrong, it’s because your client cannot find the text file. Make sure you have it.

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @unleashed_pvp unleashed pvp
item.description:
@unleashed_pvp wrote:

[quote=“durial12, post:4, topic:391797”]OS = operating system. So yes windows.

Well that error means that the server cannot find the file “mapConfig.txt”.

Try and locate this file by using a computer search. Once you have find its path (where it is in your computer…folders etc). Then go and update the path in the code wherever it occurs.[/quote]

Sorry but I don’t really understand could you help me? I’ll give you repp?

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

OS = operating system. So yes windows.

Well that error means that the server cannot find the file “mapConfig.txt”.

Try and locate this file by using a computer search. Once you have find its path (where it is in your computer…folders etc). Then go and update the path in the code wherever it occurs.

Read full topic
